subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 13 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Hiddink dismisses link to Chelsea
Guus Hiddink tells Football Focus he will not become Chelsea manager in the summer.



 
Ronaldo signs new deal at Man Utd
Portuguese winger Cristiano Ronaldo puts pen to paper on a new five-year contract at Man Utd.



 
Hargreaves set to discuss future
Owen Hargreaves expects to hold talks in the next few weeks with Bayern Munich about his future.








GOLF




Jacquelin forges clear in China
France's Raphael Jacquelin holds a two-shot lead from Australian Blyth at the Volvo China Open.



 
Kelly sets the pace in Carolina
Jerry Kelly takes a two-shot lead at the end of the first round of the Verizon Heritage tournament in South Carolina.



 
China Open leaderboard
The latest scores from the European Tour event in Shanghai.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton takes second in practice
Kimi Raikkonen goes fastest in practice for the Bahrain Grand Prix ahead of Briton Lewis Hamilton.



 
Bayliss defies finger amputation
World Superbike champion Troy Bayliss makes light of the loss of a finger to take provisional pole in Valencia.



 
Raikkonen up to speed for Bahrain
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen hopes to have put his engine problems behind him in time for this weekend's race in Bahrain.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton seeks to make F1 history
Lewis Hamilton could make Formula One history by claiming a third consecutive podium finish in Sunday's Bahrain Grand Prix.



 
Raikkonen up to speed for Bahrain
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen hopes to have put his engine problems behind him in time for this weekend's race in Bahrain.



 
Todt would welcome Brawn return
Ferrari chief Jean Todt says the team has first refusal if former technical boss Ross Brawn decides to return to Formula One.








ATHLETICS




O'Sullivan winds down in Dublin 
Sonia O'Sullivan will make her final Irish road race appearance in Sunday's Great Bupa Ireland Run.



 
Liu signs up to run in British GP
China's Olympic 110m hurdles champion and world record holder Liu Xiang will compete in the British Grand Prix in Sheffield in July.



 
Jones takes Irish Athletics role
Former UK Athletics performance director Max Jones is appointed as Ireland's director of athletics.








CYCLING




Cooke boosted ahead of Cup race
Nicole Cooke sets a new world rankings record ahead of the third World Cup race of the season.



 
Hammond takes second in Belgium
Britain's Roger Hammond finished in second place in the Gent-Wevelgem one-day classic in Belgium.



 
Cooke powers to Belgium victory
Welsh cyclist Nicole Cooke wins the Tour of Flanders to extend her World Cup lead.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Back to the future with Life on Mars and Manchester United



 
Holloway column
"I won't be having a bet on the Grand National - I've never met a skint bookie"



 
KP's rough guide to Britain
Listen to Pietersen spoof on new Radio 4 show Look Away Now
